title: Reuters Sports Schedule at 0001 GMT on Saturday
text:
January 6, 2018 / 12:05 AM / Updated 31 minutes ago Reuters Sports Schedule at 0001 GMT on Saturday Reuters Staff 
Reuters sports schedule at 0001 GMT on Saturday: SOCCER 
FA Cup third round Fleetwood Town v Leicester City (1245) Middlesbrough v Sunderland (1300) Blackburn Rovers v Hull City (1500) Cardiff City v Mansfield Town (1500) Manchester City v Burnley (1500) Wolverhampton Wanderers v Swansea City (1500) Stevenage v Reading (1500) Newcastle United v Luton Town (1500) Millwall v Barnsley (1500) Fulham v Southampton (1500) Wycombe Wanderers v Preston North End (1500) Carlisle United v Sheffield Wednesday (1500) Ipswich Town v Sheffield United (1500) Watford v Bristol City (1500) Birmingham City v Burton Albion (1500) Aston Villa v Peterborough United (1500) AFC Bournemouth v Wigan Athletic (1500) Coventry City v Stoke City (1500) Bolton Wanderers v Huddersfield Town (1500) Yeovil Town v Bradford City (1500) Brentford v Notts County (1500) Queens Park Rangers v Milton Keynes Dons (1500) Exeter City v West Bromwich Albion (1500) Doncaster Rovers v Rochdale (1500) Norwich City v Chelsea (1730) 
Premier League teams will be aiming to avoid upsets against lower division teams in the third round of the FA Cup where out of form Southampton are at Championship side Fulham and West Bromwhich Albion are at fourth-tier (League Two) Exeter City.(SOCCER-ENGLAND/CUP, expect by 1700 GMT/12 PM ET, 400 words) 
La Liga Atletico Madrid v Getafe (1200) Valencia v Girona (1515) Las Palmas v Eibar (1730) Sevilla v Real Betis (1945) 
MADRID - Atletico Madrid welcome back striker Diego Costa as they resume their chase of La Liga leaders Barcelona at home to Getafe. Valencia host Girona, while Vincenzo Montella takes his first Liga game in charge of Sevilla against fierce city rivals Real Betis. (SOCCER-SPAIN/(PIX), expect by 1400 GMT/9 AM ET, by Richard Martin, 500 words) 
Serie A Torino v Bologna (1130) Milan v Crotone (1400) Napoli v Hellas Verona (1400) SPAL v Lazio (1400) Benevento v Sampdoria (1400) Genoa v Sassuolo (1400) Roma v Atalanta (1700) Cagliari v Juventus (1945) 
Leaders Napoli host relegation-threatened Verona while second-placed Juventus are away to Cagliari and struggling giants AC Milan host Crotone in Saturday’s Serie A matches. (SOCCER-ITALY/(PIX), expect by 1600 GMT/11 AM ET, 500 words) 
French Cup Fabregues v Bourg-en-Bresse (1230) Avallon CO v Chambly (1230) Toulouse v Nice (1400) Gazélec Ajaccio v Grenoble Foot 38 (1400) Pontarlier v Montpellier (1400) Houilles v Concarneau (1400) Le Mans v Lille (1400) Chartres v Tours (1400) Saint-Lô Manche v Aubervilliers (1400) Saint-Malo v Châteauroux (1400) Schiltigheim v Auxerre (1400) Yzeure v Monaco (1700) Colomiers US v Le Puy F.43 Auvergne (1700) Hazebrouck v Caen (1700) Guingamp v Niort (1700) Angoulême v Les Herbiers (1700) Canet Roussillon v Sud Nivernais (1700) Nancy v Olympique Lyonnais (2000) CRICKET 
Fifth Ashes test, Sydney Cricket Ground (SCG) 
SYDNEY - Australia, already assured of winning the series with a 3-0 lead, resume on 193 for two, 153 runs behind England’s first innings score, with the tourists facing the tricky task of tryng to get Steve Smith (44) and Usman Khawaja (91) out. (CRICKET-ASHES/ (PIX), expect throughout, by Nick Mulvenney, 600 words) 
South Africa v India first test 
CAPE TOWN - Fit-again seamer Dale Steyn will seek to make further inroads into India’s top order as the tourists teeter at 28 for three on a lively wicket, still 258 runs behind South Africa, on the second day of the opening test at Newlands. (CRICKET-TEST-ZAF-INDIA/, expect by 1300 GMT/8 AM ET, 400 words) GOLF 
PGA Tour: Sentry Tournament of Champions, Maui (to 7) 
Leishman leads after 18 holes 
Australian Marc Leishman starts the second round with a one-stroke lead, while world number one Dustin Johnson is two behind at Kapalua Resort on the Hawaiian island of Maui. (GOLF-SENTRY/, expect by 0400 GMT/11 PM ET, 400 words). NBA 
Streaking Celtics face T-Wolves 
The Boston Celtics try to pad their lead atop the Eastern Conference and record their fifth consecutive victory when they host the Minnesota Timberwolves in one of the 10 games on the National Basketball Association’s schedule. (BASKETBALL-NBA/HIGHLIGHTS, expect by 0430 GMT/11:30 PM ET, by Field Level Media, 400 words) NHL 
Surprising Knights visit Hawks 
The expansion Vegas Golden Knights try to extend their surprising lead atop the Western Conference standings when they visit the Chicago Blackhawks while the reigning Stanley Cup champion Pittsburgh Penguins face the New York Islanders in two of the five games on the National Hockey League schedule. (ICEHOCKEY-NHL/HIGHLIGHTS, expect by 0430 GMT/11:30 PM ET, by Field Level Media, 800 words) NORTH AMERICAN SPORTS 
Roundups of off-field developments in the major North American professional sports leagues. (expect by 0000 GMT/8 PM ET, by Field Level Media, 500 words) FIGURE SKATING 
Teenager Tennell leads heading into ladies’ free skate 
After strong performances in the short program, teenager Bradie Tennell and sentimental favourite Mirai Nagasu head the field going into the ladies’ free skate at the U.S. figure skating championships in San Jose, California, where competitors have a final chance to impress before the American team is chosen for next month’s Winter Olympics. (FIGURESKATING-USA/CHAMPIONSHIPS, expect by 0500 GMT/12 AM ET, 400 words) TENNIS 
Brisbane International 
Top seed and defending Grigor Dimitrov will face the engimatic local hope Nick Kyrgios in the semi-finals, while Australian teenage wildcard Alex De Minaur will meet Ryan Harrison in the earlier match for a place in the final. (TENNIS-BRISBANE/MEN), expect by 1000 GMT/ 5 AM ET, 300 words) 
Ukraine’s Elina Svitolina, who beat champion Karolina Pliskova in the semi-finals looms as the favourite for the Brisbane International title when she faces Belarusian qualifier Aliaksandra Sasnovich in the final. (TENNIS-BRISBANE/WOMEN), expect by 1000 GMT/7 AM ET, 300 words) 
WTA - Shenzhen Open 
World number one Simona Halep will give her confidence a massive boost heading into the Australian Open when she meets Katerina Siniakova, who edged former former world number one Maria Sharapova in three sets in the second semi-final. (TENNIS-WOMEN/SHENZHEN, expect by 1100 GMT/7 AM ET, 300 words) 
Hopman Cup 
Switzerland, spearheaded by Australian Open champion Roger Federer, will be looking to preserve their 100 percent winning run at this year’s Hopman Cup when they take on Germany in the final. (TENNIS-HOPMAN/, expect by 1500 GMT/10 AM ET, 300 words) 
WTA International - Auckland Classic 
Poor weather over the last two days in Auckland have forced organisers to schedule double-header matches for players like Caroline Wozniacki and Agnieszka Radwanska to get through the quartteer-finals and semi-final matches for a place in the final, which has also been shifted to Sunday. (TENNIS-AUCKLAND/WOMEN, 150 words) 
ATP - Qatar Open 
Mercurial Frenchman Gael Monfils will meet up and coming Russian Andrey Rublev in the final of the Qatar Open. (TENNIS-DOHA/MEN, expect by 1600 GMT/11 AM ET, 300 words) ALPINE SKIING 
World Cup 
A
